comment: Prof Chavoshi provided plenty of recourse for me to learn in this online course. She responded to emails quickly and worked with me when I had to miss the midterm. My only complaint was that there were no videos going over the slides. If you are diligent in going through online content and want to learn, I would recommend her.

If the only thing you care about is learning the material then she's fine, but don't expect any enthusiasm, energy, or creativity in her lessons. Other nitpicks are that she enforces a phone ban, she forces us to manually type out data-entry instead of copy/paste, and she uses the exact same example scenario in almost every topic.

Mona was very flexible and helpful. The layout of her course in D2L is very organized and thoughtful. She seems to understand the difference between teaching academia and teaching necessary skills to take on the job. The workload was manageable and fun. Easy A with a good user experience.

- Unclear, contradictory instructions.
- Email communication was bad. Responses were vague, tone was dismissive, and she always assumed you were wrong instead of checking D2L (like when she forgot to post certain material to D2L).
- Last-minute changes to project instructions punishes you if you don't work on things last minute.

Accent is a bit much to get used to but she was available outside of class and changed due dates to accomodate us. Reminded us of coursework. Lectures ARE boring and she kind of drags on but the content is pretty simple and all her powerpoints are online. Not sure why so many negative reviews - easy A + sql is an industry standard.

The Lectures are incredibly boring because she speaks in a monotone voice and takes ages to get to the next word in her sentence. When creating a prototype for the group project which is semester wide, my group was deducted half of our points for not submitting everything in 1 pdf. In all Professor Chavoshi is a very unpleasant class to take.

She sounds like she memorized a script and is forgetting her lines every time she lectures. Don't bother asking questions, she doesn't know the answers. 99% of the time she will just say "oh just do what it says" or "it's exactly what it sounds like" without explanation. Still confused? "Just think about it more it will make sense eventually".

The online database class is mostly based around the labs and project. The prof. clearly laid out the criteria for these and graded very fairly. As far as teaching the content goes... I'm not sure. The content is fairly simple so I didn't look too much into the slides etc. that were made available.

It gives me anxiety having to hear her for an hour, she always stops phrases as if she needed to think about what she is about to say. For sure it was the worst experience I had at KSU, I hope she gets better.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: You can't understand a word she says. In every lecture I would do homework for other classes because it was so awfully bad I couldn't stand it. I didn't learn a single thing and the group project is extremely annoying I had to do most of it. I would not recommend her for any class at KSU I am unsure how she has a job because she is so bad at it.

She pulls all of her lectures from another professor and can't answer questions. The group project is most of the grade and the instructions were incredibly vague. We needed to constantly ask for her help just to understand what to do and we'd still get an 80. You are better off just reading the textbook and ignoring lecture. Avoid like the plague.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Highly skeptical of her grading practices. Even if a test is all multiple choice, you won't get a grade for days. I think its because she adjusts grades manually- this is directly from her syllabus "The instructor retains the right to subjectively adjust an individual student's grade in appropriate cases, based upon observed performance."
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: The lectures are just her struggling to read from the PowerPoint for an hour. The tests are all essay response questions to concepts you are barely taught. None of the projects have a visible rubric so you constantly have to check if you're doing what she wants and you will still end up making an 80. Save yourself the headache and avoid this class.
Very difficult to understand her lectures and explain her something. Magaj no bhosdo kari didho.

All the work are just tedious and not hard. The topics we write about are very interesting which made it a bit easier to write. A few papers and discussions and only had 2 exams. Also I took this class as a May Session.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--So many papers

comment: No textbook provided for this class. Professor grades quickly & harshly over night. Doesn't help, understand, or explain... other students said they also received unhelpful responses & unnecessarily rude feedback... just makes things harder than they need to be. Won't take this professor again.

One of the worst teachers at Kennesaw. she treats everyone like high schoolers. she doesn't understand the material she's teaching and stole her lesson plan from another teacher and still cant teach it well.(she changed the email in the lesson plan but forgot to change the hyperlinks to the other teachers email) Don't take her if you have a choice.
Really enjoyed this class. Assignments were clear on exactly what they wanted you to do and how they wanted you to do it, which is a rare thing in the KSU CS department. Would definitely take again.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took her for Database and she wasn't that bad. She was always super nice, but her accent can make her seem rude. Her lectures are kind of boring, but she's really good at doing diagrams, SQL and visual studio stuff so I enjoyed her on that stuff. She's always reminding you when stuff is due and she grades pretty easily. Honestly easy class.

There are three tests, one of those is the final. There's a group project and the instructions can be vague but if you have a good group it's manageable. She will say that the test is multiple-choice and free-response, but it's always just free-response. She doesn't let you view your test after she grades it, so you don't know what you missed.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: I had to teach myself everything. I might as well been the prof.

Amazing professor and kind person. Not sure why her reviews are so low but this is my second time taking her and she is a great professor. You learn Dia tool, SQL sever and other database software and materials. The tests are 2 parts. First part is online and the second part is in class. All of which is taught to you. It is very possible to get a A

She's not amazing, but she's not as bad as some people on here say. She takes some getting used to at first because of the way she talks. She's actually pretty nice though and will help each individual student in class if they're having SQL errors. Her assignments and tests are pretty easy if you follow along in class.
Terrible professor. She has awkward pauses. I feel like she does not know what she is talking about sometimes. She cannot even answer some questions sometimes.

I don't know why her ratings are so low, but she is a great professor. She taught from the slides, but gave plenty of examples and was not difficult about answering questions(she didn't make you feel dumb). Her tests and quizzes weren't hard, neither was the project, and she even gave extra credit if you went to the on campus conference.

She's just awful. She teaches from powerpoints that she has never seen before the lecture. She answers questions by just repeating some vague point from the slide. Her assignments seem to be written and graded by someone else entirely, since what she grades for is entirely different than what she provides. Her feedback is copy-pasted and rng-like.
Good teacher, went over everything that was going to be on tests, gave example problems based on what was necessary to learn. I would definitely recommend anyone to take her class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Not the greatest, but she's done pretty well for my class. The first half is breeze, but after the midterm, it definitely helps to show up to class. She usually does in class examples (probably a few too many, but oh well) to ensure we get the concepts. Everything's posted online, so the only thing keeping me in class is the attendance policy.
She is the worst teacher ever, she only just read the syllabus and you figure it on your own, ask her any question out of the book or the power point she will be LOST!! Will never take her again!
